sentences.sContent: Then he turned the handle and went in.
sentences.sCn: 然后他转动把手走了进去。

sentences.sContent: ...It's time to reevaluate how women handle conflict at work...
...One can often handle tension headaches by rubbing and pressing back neck muscles...
...Your body didn't evolve to handle this kind of thing...
...Historically markets have been able to handle these things...

...RelayRides and SnapGoods match up owners and renters; smartphones with GPS let people see where the nearest rentable car is parked; social networks provide a way to check up on people and build trust; and online payment systems handle the billing...
...I think eventually markets will handle this one...
...People in supportive relationships may handle stress better...
...A new set of considerations has come to the fore as part of the debate about how we handle children...

synos.tran: 处理；操作；运用；买卖；触摸

phrases.pCn: 手柄；杠杆手柄；杆式手柄；手柄操纵杆
扶手；握柄；车顶安全把手

remMethod.val: hand(手) ＋ le → 方便手操作的东西 → 操作， 处理

words.tran: 处理者；管理者；拳击教练；（犬马等的）训练者
使用；负责；触摸；指挥（handle的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the part of a door that you use for opening it
to touch something or pick it up and hold it in your hands
